pr_title: Adding the `from.platforms` Jib config parameter to jib-maven-plugin and to the jib-gradle-plugin

timeline.message: Adding the plugins tag for Jib-Maven-Plugin

timeline.bodyText:
Can the platforms list not be empty?
If we were to initialize this to an empty list at line 154, would it break the default beahavior?
timeline.author: loosebazooka

replies.bodyText: The idea is to have a default platform amd64/linux in the platforms  list any time a user fails to specify a platform.
replies.author: louismurerwa
chanseokoh

replies.bodyText: Done
replies.author: louismurerwa

timeline.bodyText: Add comments about default perhaps?
timeline.author: loosebazooka

replies.bodyText:
What would an appropriate comment look like for this constructor?Would this work?
`/** Initializing a default platform in case a user doesn't pass in one **/
replies.author: louismurerwa

replies.bodyText:
I think for IDE users, just seeing the pop up of:
/** Configuration for {@code platform} parameter. Defaults to amd64/linux. **/

is helpful, since they wont have to go into the code and see what the defaults are?
But commenting sometimes feels pretty subjective. This is just how I would do it.
replies.author: loosebazooka

replies.bodyText: I agree commenting is subjective sometimes.I think your suggested comment works well in this case.
replies.author: louismurerwa

timeline.bodyText: This comment seems out of place?
timeline.author: loosebazooka

replies.bodyText: Yes !! I put it as place holder because the style guide required me to put Javadoc comment at this line.
replies.author: louismurerwa

replies.bodyText: Right maybe change it to /** Constructor for defaults . **/ or something?
replies.author: loosebazooka

replies.bodyText: Done
replies.author: louismurerwa

timeline.bodyText: getOs() and getArchitecture() may not need to be public? I see some getters in other nested -Configuration classes don't have public. We can start with as much limited visibility as possible.
timeline.author: chanseokoh

replies.bodyText: We never use these methods locally so making them private throws  unused  method warnings .
replies.author: louismurerwa

replies.bodyText: Java has so-called "package-private" in addition to public, protected, and private. Just remove the public keyword, and the method will also be accessible from any class in the same Java package.
replies.author: chanseokoh

replies.bodyText:
Nicee !! This is an interesting concept Java concept.
Done.
replies.author: louismurerwa

timeline.bodyText: At the current state, I don't think this method can ever return null. In that case, we should remove @Nullable.
timeline.author: chanseokoh

replies.bodyText: Thats true .Done.
replies.author: louismurerwa

timeline.bodyText:
As discussed in the design doc, if we are going to raise an error when one of these are missing, I think we have to make these @Nullable and not assign default values.
Need to add @Nullable in getters too.
timeline.author: chanseokoh

replies.bodyText: Done
replies.author: louismurerwa

timeline.author: chanseokoh

replies.bodyText: Makes sense !! Done
replies.author: louismurerwa

replies.bodyText: You can mark a GitHub conversion "resolved" yourself if you believe the issue is cleanly resolved (but only after you pushed new changes).
replies.author: chanseokoh

timeline.message:
New option to skip pushing images (manifests) if the image (manifest) already exists in the target registry (#2531)

* Adds proposal to control the pushing of tags on existing images in target registry.

* Updates proposal with more detail.

* Work for tags-on-existing-images.md

* Cleanup.

* * Simplified implementation:
  * Removed newly added class ManifestDescriptor, replaced it with already existing ManifestAndDigest.
  * Removed the CheckImageStep and incorporated the check within the PushImageStep. Implementation now follows similar checks, eg, in PushBlopStep.
* Adds unit and integration tests.
* Fixes resulting from testing.

* Code formatting changes.

* Code cleanup, post-review.

* Code cleanup, post-review.

* * Adds a new CheckImageStep and integrates it in the StepsRunner.
* Reverts PushImageStep to the state before the PR started, apart from the manifest existence check.

* Refactor code

* CHANGELOG

* Update comments

* Improve test

Co-authored-by: Chanseok Oh <chanseok@google.com>

timeline.author: chanseokoh

timeline.bodyText:
Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
             *         os = 'value1'
          
          
            
             *         architecture = 'value2'
          
          
            
             *         os = 'linux'
          
          
            
             *         architecture = 'amd64'
timeline.author: chanseokoh
chanseokoh

timeline.bodyText: You need to add some annotations like this. For example, @Optional tells the Gradle system that from.platforms is an optional config that the user doesn't have to specify.
timeline.author: chanseokoh

timeline.bodyText:
Needs to add @Input as in ExtensionsParameters. This tells Gradle that platform.os is an input parameter.
And I think you may need setters. Please check if setting platform.os = ... in build.gradle actually works.
timeline.author: chanseokoh
